title: What is the difference between a single discount of 30% and a single discount equivalent to two successive discounts of 25% and 5%, being given on shopping of ₹2,000? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends….! Single discount of 30% on ₹2000 30/100 × 2000 = ₹600 Price of item after discount ₹2000 - ₹600 = ₹1400 After two successive discount of 25% and 5% First discount of 25% on ₹2000 25/100 × 2000 = ₹ 500 Price after first discount = ₹2000 - ₹500 = ₹1500 Second discount of 5% on discounted amount ₹1500 5/100 × 1500 = 1500/20 = 150/2 = ₹75 Price of item after second discount = ₹2000 - ₹75 = ₹1425 Difference between single discount of 30% and two successive discounts of 25% and 5% Discounted price difference ₹1500 - ₹1425 = ₹75 The price of item after single discount of 30% is more than the price after two successive discounts of 25% and 5% Answer Two successive discounts of 25% and 5% are more beneficial to buyer than single discount of 30%

The formula of calculating the equivalent discount= 1st discount%+2nd discount%-(1st×2nd)/100 25+5–(25×5)/100 25+5–1.25 30–1.25=28.75% Now the difference between these two are= 30–28.75=1.25% Now the total difference on ₹ 2000= (1.25×2000)/100=₹ 25. Hence the answer will be ₹ 25.
